CNSA CMS: The debris of the upper stage of the Long March 5B Y3 rocket (CZ5B) has re-entered the atmosphere in Sulu sea around 119.0°E, 9.1°N, and most of the components have been burnt out during re-entry. Source:  https://t.co/YMAfF6BARq  https://t.co/8U9tDb441h
Reentry of Long March 5B Y3 rocket (CZ5B) upper stage debris spotted in Kuching, Malaysia 🇲🇾. Reentering in progress.
The reentering CZ5B upper stage debris has a diameter of 5m, and a height of 33m. It will mostly burn during entering, but will have major leftover due to its mere size.  https://t.co/cR3kb5Hisd

CNSA CMS: As of UTC 05:00 on July 30, 2022, the orbit of the uncontrolled upper stage debris of the Long March 5B carrier rocket is 151.4 km at perigee, 187.0 km at apogee and 41.4° at inclination. Reentering expected to happen within hours. Source:  https://t.co/uXIKOC0mTL  https://t.co/ROUqPV2tfx
